Qualifiers.Scope: An invisible tent-like plane intended to contain development on a lot in a way that preserves privacy and exposure to natural light for adjacent properties. It works in conjunction with setbacks and height limits.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Regulates structures located within the buildable area.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Does not apply to structures located in the rear and/or side yards. These are regulated by the 'accessory-structure daylight plan'.

Variables.Dimensional: Average grade; Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall); Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot; Max. building height.

Constants.Numerical values: Angle of plane: 45°; Starting height of plane: 10 feet from average grade; Maximum height for specific portions: 24 feet. (Note: The condition for applying the 24' max is ambiguous due to unclear text: '24' max. for portions [unclear remainder of this note]').
Constants.Specs: The side daylight plane is measured vertically up from the side lot line.
Constants.Procedures: The daylight plane is measured from 'average grade'. 'Average grade' is established using 'existing grade' before any grading or fill occurs.

Conditions.Mandatory: Structures within the buildable area must be contained within the primary daylight plane.
Conditions.Conditional logic: If a structure is within the buildable area, its profile must not penetrate the 45-degree plane that starts 10 feet above average grade at the side lot line.
Conditions.Dependencies: The final maximum allowed building height is dependent on this daylight plane rule AND the Building Code. (Note: Ambiguous language in source: 'Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code').

Exceptions.Special cases: A maximum height of 24 feet applies to certain portions of a structure, but the specific conditions for this case are not fully legible in the source text.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a component of a larger regulatory framework that includes setbacks and height limits to control the overall building envelope.
Relationships.Cross-references: Code Section 18.12.040 (a) Table 2 (p. 26, 28); Code Section 18.04 (p. 27); Code Section 18.12.050 (b) (2) (p. 29); Code Section 18.12.040 (i) (p. 29); Figure 44 (p. 42) for definition of 'Average grade'; Building Code for overall maximum height.
Relationships.Logical dependencies: This rule for 'Primary' structures is distinct from the 'accessory-structure daylight plan' which applies to structures in rear/side yards. The 'Side' daylight plane (measured at lot line) is distinct from the 'Rear' daylight plane (measured at rear setback).
